004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tResourceType;
008import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
009import edu.wpi.first.hal.SerialPortJNI;
010import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
011
012/** Driver for the serial ports (USB, MXP, Onboard) on the roboRIO. */
013public class SerialPort implements AutoCloseable {
014  private int m_portHandle;
015
016  public enum Port {
017    kOnboard(0),
018    kMXP(1),
019    kUSB(2),
020    kUSB1(2),
021    kUSB2(3);
022
023    public final int value;
024
025    Port(int value) {
026      this.value = value;
027    }
028  }
029
030  /** Represents the parity to use for serial communications. */
031  public enum Parity {
032    kNone(0),
033    kOdd(1),
034    kEven(2),
035    kMark(3),
036    kSpace(4);
037
038    public final int value;
039
040    Parity(int value) {
041      this.value = value;
042    }
043  }
044
045  /** Represents the number of stop bits to use for Serial Communication. */
046  public enum StopBits {
047    kOne(10),
048    kOnePointFive(15),
049    kTwo(20);
050
051    public final int value;
052
053    StopBits(int value) {
054      this.value = value;
055    }
056  }
057
058  /** Represents what type of flow control to use for serial communication. */
059  public enum FlowControl {
060    kNone(0),
061    kXonXoff(1),
062    kRtsCts(2),
063    kDtsDsr(4);
064
065    public final int value;
066
067    FlowControl(int value) {
068      this.value = value;
069    }
070  }
071
072  /** Represents which type of buffer mode to use when writing to a serial port. */
073  public enum WriteBufferMode {
074    kFlushOnAccess(1),
075    kFlushWhenFull(2);
076
077    public final int value;
078
079    WriteBufferMode(int value) {
080      this.value = value;
081    }
082  }
083
084  /**
085   * Create an instance of a Serial Port class.
086   *
087   * @param baudRate The baud rate to configure the serial port.
088   * @param port The Serial port to use
089   * @param dataBits The number of data bits per transfer. Valid values are between 5 and 8 bits.
090   * @param parity Select the type of parity checking to use.
091   * @param stopBits The number of stop bits to use as defined by the enum StopBits.
092   */
093  public SerialPort(
094      final int baudRate, Port port, final int dataBits, Parity parity, StopBits stopBits) {
095    m_portHandle = SerialPortJNI.serialInitializePort((byte) port.value);
096    SerialPortJNI.serialSetBaudRate(m_portHandle, baudRate);
097    SerialPortJNI.serialSetDataBits(m_portHandle, (byte) dataBits);
098    SerialPortJNI.serialSetParity(m_portHandle, (byte) parity.value);
099    SerialPortJNI.serialSetStopBits(m_portHandle, (byte) stopBits.value);
100
101    // Set the default read buffer size to 1 to return bytes immediately
102    setReadBufferSize(1);
103
104    // Set the default timeout to 5 seconds.
105    setTimeout(5.0);
106
107    // Don't wait until the buffer is full to transmit.
108    setWriteBufferMode(WriteBufferMode.kFlushOnAccess);
109
110    disableTermination();
111
112    HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_SerialPort, port.value + 1);
113  }
114
115  /**
116   * Create an instance of a Serial Port class. Defaults to one stop bit.
117   *
118   * @param baudRate The baud rate to configure the serial port.
119   * @param port The serial port to use.
120   * @param dataBits The number of data bits per transfer. Valid values are between 5 and 8 bits.
121   * @param parity Select the type of parity checking to use.
122   */
123  public SerialPort(final int baudRate, Port port, final int dataBits, Parity parity) {
124    this(baudRate, port, dataBits, parity, StopBits.kOne);
125  }
126
127  /**
128   * Create an instance of a Serial Port class. Defaults to no parity and one stop bit.
129   *
130   * @param baudRate The baud rate to configure the serial port.
131   * @param port The serial port to use.
132   * @param dataBits The number of data bits per transfer. Valid values are between 5 and 8 bits.
133   */
134  public SerialPort(final int baudRate, Port port, final int dataBits) {
135    this(baudRate, port, dataBits, Parity.kNone, StopBits.kOne);
136  }
137
138  /**
139   * Create an instance of a Serial Port class. Defaults to 8 databits, no parity, and one stop bit.
140   *
141   * @param baudRate The baud rate to configure the serial port.
142   * @param port The serial port to use.
143   */
144  public SerialPort(final int baudRate, Port port) {
145    this(baudRate, port, 8, Parity.kNone, StopBits.kOne);
146  }
147
148  @Override
149  public void close() {
150    SerialPortJNI.serialClose(m_portHandle);
151  }
152
153  /**
154   * Set the type of flow control to enable on this port.
155   *
156   * <p>By default, flow control is disabled.
157   *
158   * @param flowControl the FlowControl m_value to use
159   */
160  public void setFlowControl(FlowControl flowControl) {
161    SerialPortJNI.serialSetFlowControl(m_portHandle, (byte) flowControl.value);
162  }
163
164  /**
165   * Enable termination and specify the termination character.
166   *
167   * <p>Termination is currently only implemented for receive. When the the terminator is received,
168   * the read() or readString() will return fewer bytes than requested, stopping after the
169   * terminator.
170   *
171   * @param terminator The character to use for termination.
172   */
173  public void enableTermination(char terminator) {
174    SerialPortJNI.serialEnableTermination(m_portHandle, terminator);
175  }
176
177  /**
178   * Enable termination with the default terminator '\n'
179   *
180   * <p>Termination is currently only implemented for receive. When the the terminator is received,
181   * the read() or readString() will return fewer bytes than requested, stopping after the
182   * terminator.
183   *
184   * <p>The default terminator is '\n'
185   */
186  public void enableTermination() {
187    enableTermination('\n');
188  }
189
190  /** Disable termination behavior. */
191  public void disableTermination() {
192    SerialPortJNI.serialDisableTermination(m_portHandle);
193  }
194
195  /**
196   * Get the number of bytes currently available to read from the serial port.
197   *
198   * @return The number of bytes available to read.
199   */
200  public int getBytesReceived() {
201    return SerialPortJNI.serialGetBytesReceived(m_portHandle);
202  }
203
204  /**
205   * Read a string out of the buffer. Reads the entire contents of the buffer
206   *
207   * @return The read string
208   */
209  public String readString() {
210    return readString(getBytesReceived());
211  }
212
213  /**
214   * Read a string out of the buffer. Reads the entire contents of the buffer
215   *
216   * @param count the number of characters to read into the string
217   * @return The read string
218   */
219  public String readString(int count) {
220    byte[] out = read(count);
221    return new String(out, 0, out.length, StandardCharsets.US_ASCII);
222  }
223
224  /**
225   * Read raw bytes out of the buffer.
226   *
227   * @param count The maximum number of bytes to read.
228   * @return An array of the read bytes
229   */
230  public byte[] read(final int count) {
231    byte[] dataReceivedBuffer = new byte[count];
232    int gotten = SerialPortJNI.serialRead(m_portHandle, dataReceivedBuffer, count);
233    if (gotten == count) {
234      return dataReceivedBuffer;
235    }
236    byte[] retVal = new byte[gotten];
237    System.arraycopy(dataReceivedBuffer, 0, retVal, 0, gotten);
238    return retVal;
239  }
240
241  /**
242   * Write raw bytes to the serial port.
243   *
244   * @param buffer The buffer of bytes to write.
245   * @param count The maximum number of bytes to write.
246   * @return The number of bytes actually written into the port.
247   */
248  public int write(byte[] buffer, int count) {
249    if (buffer.length < count) {
250      throw new IllegalArgumentException("buffer is too small, must be at least " + count);
251    }
252    return SerialPortJNI.serialWrite(m_portHandle, buffer, count);
253  }
254
255  /**
256   * Write a string to the serial port.
257   *
258   * @param data The string to write to the serial port.
259   * @return The number of bytes actually written into the port.
260   */
261  public int writeString(String data) {
262    return write(data.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8), data.length());
263  }
264
265  /**
266   * Configure the timeout of the serial m_port.
267   *
268   * <p>This defines the timeout for transactions with the hardware. It will affect reads if less
269   * bytes are available than the read buffer size (defaults to 1) and very large writes.
270   *
271   * @param timeout The number of seconds to to wait for I/O.
272   */
273  public void setTimeout(double timeout) {
274    SerialPortJNI.serialSetTimeout(m_portHandle, timeout);
275  }
276
277  /**
278   * Specify the size of the input buffer.
279   *
280   * <p>Specify the amount of data that can be stored before data from the device is returned to
281   * Read. If you want data that is received to be returned immediately, set this to 1.
282   *
283   * <p>It the buffer is not filled before the read timeout expires, all data that has been received
284   * so far will be returned.
285   *
286   * @param size The read buffer size.
287   */
288  public void setReadBufferSize(int size) {
289    SerialPortJNI.serialSetReadBufferSize(m_portHandle, size);
290  }
291
292  /**
293   * Specify the size of the output buffer.
294   *
295   * <p>Specify the amount of data that can be stored before being transmitted to the device.
296   *
297   * @param size The write buffer size.
298   */
299  public void setWriteBufferSize(int size) {
300    SerialPortJNI.serialSetWriteBufferSize(m_portHandle, size);
301  }
302
303  /**
304   * Specify the flushing behavior of the output buffer.
305   *
306   * <p>When set to kFlushOnAccess, data is synchronously written to the serial port after each call
307   * to either print() or write().
308   *
309   * <p>When set to kFlushWhenFull, data will only be written to the serial port when the buffer is
310   * full or when flush() is called.
311   *
312   * @param mode The write buffer mode.
313   */
314  public void setWriteBufferMode(WriteBufferMode mode) {
315    SerialPortJNI.serialSetWriteMode(m_portHandle, (byte) mode.value);
316  }
317
318  /**
319   * Force the output buffer to be written to the port.
320   *
321   * <p>This is used when setWriteBufferMode() is set to kFlushWhenFull to force a flush before the
322   * buffer is full.
323   */
324  public void flush() {
325    SerialPortJNI.serialFlush(m_portHandle);
326  }
327
328  /**
329   * Reset the serial port driver to a known state.
330   *
331   * <p>Empty the transmit and receive buffers in the device and formatted I/O.
332   */
333  public void reset() {
334    SerialPortJNI.serialClear(m_portHandle);
335  }
336}
